Posts.Title: Long Term Survivors at Conference LuAnnH 3littlegirls

Posts.Content: Stefanie wrote: Hi Ladies, I am looking for some advice and input on my situation. I currently work full-time at the same job for over 5 years and go to school part-time. I decided over a year ago to full fill my dream in becoming a RN. After finding out that I am Stage IV in October of last year, I was devistated ( like all of you) and my dream shattered right in front of me. After lots of sleepless nights and talking to my dear boyfriend he said not to give up on that dream. Even if my life might be cut short it might not be too short to still become a RN and to full fill my dream. Now here is my dilemma: Working full-time at a job that I don't like and going to school has become very hard. I would love to go to school full-time, but I need insurance and of course money to live. Is anybody on disability and goes to school full-time? I am so unhappy in my current situation and I am looking for some ideas!  Thank you for your input...and as always..I am so happy I found all of you wonderful friends.. Many hugs, Stefanie Dx 10/30/2008, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Stefanie wrote: Hi Ladies, well I saw Onc today to go over Petscan...progression in Lymphnodes but luckily no spread to any other organs! Since Femara and Faslodex didn't do the job, he is thinking to biopsy the lymphnodes in my armpit to see if my BC switched from ER+ to ER-! He said it can happen in less than 10% of cases but he wanted to make sure ! Has any of you switched from ER+ to - once it's metastasized? Again....rollercoaster ride!!!! I hate this darn cancer...I know all of you do but it's a constant UP and DOWN!!!!! I am so frustrated and depressed...having a cocktail tonight all by myself..which I usually don't do...but what the hell...!!!! Love you all.... Posts.Content: Stefanie wrote: Hi ladies....just looking for some sympathy...after my step grandson was born this week, my boyfriend and I went out to celebrate...and sure enough, I got pulled over and was charged with a DUI...!  HOW stupid of me. I've been a mess. I met with a lawyer today, but he wants $4500.00 to retain him...I can't afford that kind of money! He thought we have a good case to hopefully get a deferred sentence since I have no prior criminal record! ANy advice....besides telling me that I AM VERY STUPID? Dx 10/30/2008, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2012 08:43AM Stefanie wrote: Thanks for all the replies! Today is the day..starting the new chemo! My program director in school is allowing me to take an incomplete on the class and I have until December to finish this class! I am so happy. I feel that I just had to put school "on Hold" for a little bit and I didn't waste the time I already invested in it! THe weirdest thing...last night was the first night I had no pain and slept 6 hours without waking up having to take any pain pills..YEAH! SophieJean...I hope the Gemzar is destroying the C for us...I am hopeful!!!! Hugs to all....
Posts.Title: All good tings come to an end...Gemzar? Stefanie lwd

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2010 12:47AM Stefanie wrote: Janis..I truly think you will not regret your decision....It's been exactly one year for me since I have been on disability..I didn't think I can live without my hectic, exciting work day,,guess what? I didn't realize how much stuff I have been doing and how much happier I am..! In my case I finally full-fill my dream in becoming a nurse and I am in school full-time..I love every minute of it.  Your boys will enjoy having their Mom around too...another thing..I sleep until at least 8:30 or 9 every morning...it's soo nice! Hugs

Posts.Title: All good tings come to an end...Gemzar? Stefanie lwd

Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2009 10:36AM Stefanie wrote: KImberly, I had bc originally 4 years ago, had a mastectomy and chemo and was diagnosed with mets to my chest ( mainly in my pleural) and in my neck in October of this year. I am also ER+/PR+,HER2-. My doctor put me on Femara and Zolodex to shut down my ovaries. My onc also told me that araomatase inhibitors is a great start and unless we find that it doesn't work anymore by doing scans every 3-6 month that I could be on that treatment at least a couple of years. I wish you the best of luck and I am quite the first comer as well, I have been learning so much from all the ladies on this site, it's amazing! Hugs, Stefanie

Posts.Title: My oncology nurse (bragging) Fitztwins bourscheid

Posts.Content: Stefanie wrote: I am so bummed...after 2 years of Taxol and Herceptin with such little S/E where I was able to go to school to full-fill my dream in becoming a Nurse, just shattered over night! I have had episodes of right side pain over the last 3 months and the CT scan revealed 12 lesions on my liver( from 4 lesions just 4 moths ago)..darn it! Switching to GEMZAR and Caroplatin, Herceptin. Is anyone on this treatment? How are the S/E? My onc is hoping that the new TDM-1 is approved soon..he believes it will be a great treatment. Another question...my pain gets so severe sometimes at night..that even a Vicodin won't help! I hate narcotics..is there any pain medication that helps better than others? Hugs to all of you..! Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2010 11:19PM Stefanie wrote: Hey Renee... I am starting Faslodex on Monday..Femara is done working for me. Tumor Markers went up and Pet Scan showed slight progression. My onc told me he is starting me with double dosage the first time, then again in 2 weeks and then single dosage monthly. I will let you know how I feel...when are you starting the trial? Many hugs...
Posts.Title: Falsodex Reneepals Stefanie

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 04:40PM Stefanie wrote: Hey Janis, you mentioned your mom, I have to agree with you. I love my mom dearly but for example when I had my overies removed she said.."great, that will kill the cancer and watch it ...you will be cured!" Or she says, you must be feeling great since I don't complain or because I don't talk about the cancer. As you know...we might not talk about but sure think about it 100 times a day. It takes alot to keep it together ALL THE TIME and have the right attitude ALL THE TIME...and then I see people at work who get so upset because they didn't reach their sales goal for the week ( I work in staffing)..and I think to myself..what's a stupid sales number compared to having a terminal illness..!!! But those are all thoughts I don't share with nobody! Sorry for venting...but YES I believe in having a good attitude, I don't like to be miserable...but the cancer is still there!

Posts.Content: May 20, 2009 10:50PM Stefanie wrote: Stable is great...I am on Femara for 6 month now and my markers keep going down as well. I tolerate the Femara pretty good as well, except carpel tunnel syndrome ( numbness in my right hand) especially at night. We are not sure if it's a SE from the Femara, but other ladies had mentioned it before..so hey STABLE is good...and you never know this treatment might put us in ALL CLEAR..! Good luck to you.
